alert.note: Alert for Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 07 at 9:03PM CDT until May 07 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern Texas, including the following county, Knox. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. A flash flood warning remains in effect for the Benjamin area where 5 to 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Benjamin, Rhineland and Truscott. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
